meanings.sent1: The teacher agnized the hard work of the students.
meanings.sent2: She agnized her friend's voice in the crowded room.
meanings.sent3: The cat agnized the mouse but pretended not to see it.
meanings.sent4: The old tree agnized the passing seasons with its changing leaves.
meanings.sent5: The detective agnized the suspect from the security footage.

meanings.sent1: He agnized his mistake and apologized sincerely.
meanings.sent2: The criminal finally agnized his involvement in the crime.
meanings.sent3: The child agnized to eating the last cookie before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The politician agnized to accepting bribes during the investigation.
meanings.sent5: She agnized her fear of heights during the climbing expedition.
